text:
after passing though the proxy server the html was changed.

from:
<INPUT TYPE="HIDDEN" ID="ENCODING_TEST" NAME="ENCODING_TEST" VALUE="㌐" />
to:
<INPUT TYPE="HIDDEN" ID="ENCODING_TEST" NAME="ENCODING_TEST" VALUE="?" />

and the string queue should be:
ENCODING_TEST=%E3%8C%90
but is now:
ENCODING_TEST=%3F
creator: cwang@mincron.com
cwang@mincron.com
text:
from the server
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8

in jmeter.properties
sampleresult.default.encoding=UTF-8

I think somewhere along the way in the proxy the html string was converted to
ASCII or ISO-8859-1.

creator: alf@i100.no
text: Just to let you know that I'm starting to look into this now.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
As far as I can see, the value is just a sequence of ASCII characters which 
are valid in all normal character sets.

I just tried a test using a simple form and there was no change to the HTML. 
This can be seen by adding a tree view listener to the proxy server, and by 
using view source in the browser.

I think there must be something else happening here; please describe what you 
are doing in more detail.
Unless more detail is provided, there's nothing to be done here.
creator: sebb@apache.org
